Ed Gentry.action: Struggles desperately with the water, trying to get his feet forward and eventually manages to slide over moss-covered rocks.

Ed Gentry.action: Screams at the top of his lungs to go right down the middle of the rapids and urges for speed.

Ed Gentry.action: Lets go of his paddle and grabs for the bow at his feet as the canoe overturns.

Ed Gentry.action: Struggles desperately with the water, trying multiple times to get his feet forward and eventually succeeds, elongating his body to slide over moss-covered rocks on his back.
Ed Gentry.assessment: Ed demonstrates physical endurance, problem-solving, and river survival skills, showing competence in managing himself in a life-threatening environment.

Ed Gentry.action: Hits the back of his head on a big rock but quickly recovers and continues sliding down the river.
Ed Gentry.assessment: Despite injury, Ed maintains focus and continues to navigate the river, indicating resilience and mental toughness.

Ed Gentry.action: Shows a curious look of pained pleasure as he slides along the rocks, still alive.

Ed Gentry.action: Goes over the last big rock and down into calm water after the rapids.
Ed Gentry.assessment: Successfully surviving the final dangerous stretch of the rapids indicates effective navigation and physical capability.

Ed Gentry.action: Moves towards Lewis who is injured and struggling in the water, tells him to hold on, and helps him to the bank.

Ed Gentry.action: Glances back from time to time while helping Lewis, looking for Drew.
Ed Gentry.assessment: Eds attentiveness to others safety beyond the immediate injured person shows his consideration and responsibility towards the group.

Ed Gentry.action: Goes to Lewis after helping him onto a rock and tries to make him comfortable despite Lewiss severe pain.
Ed Gentry.assessment: Eds effort to comfort Lewis in pain reflects empathy and sincere concern for his friends wellbeing.

Ed Gentry.action: Floats in the water after navigating dangerous rapids, assessing his situation despite pain and injury.

Ed Gentry.action: Clumsily tries to rearrange himself in the water to look upstream and search for others.

Ed Gentry.action: Moves towards Lewis, who is injured and struggling in the water, and helps him to the bank.
Ed Gentry.assessment: This demonstrates physical strength, quick decision-making, and leadership in a crisis, reflecting strong competence.

Ed Gentry.action: Glances back repeatedly looking for Drew while assisting Lewis.

Ed Gentry.action: Bends down to Lewis to try to make him comfortable and listens as Lewis tries to communicate.

Ed Gentry.action: Goes to Lewis and tries to make him comfortable despite Lewis's severe pain.

Ed Gentry.action: Responds to Lewis's news about Drew being shot with stunned disbelief and concern.

Ed Gentry.action: Encourages Bobby to search for Drew and joins him in the cold water despite his revulsion.

Ed Gentry.action: Discusses the danger they face and the possibility that the attacker intends to kill them all.

Ed Gentry.action: Tries to make Lewis comfortable despite Lewis's severe pain and distress.

Ed Gentry.action: Responds to Lewis's revelation about Drew being shot with stunned silence and confusion.

Ed Gentry.action: Decides to search for Drew despite the dangerous conditions and his own unease about re-entering cold water.

Ed Gentry.action: Engages in conversation with Bobby about the situation while physically exhausted and wet, maintaining focus on the threat.

Ed Gentry.action: Recovers control quickly after his angry outburst and speaks calmly with Bobby about their situation.

Ed Gentry.action: Shouts at Lewis, calling him 'ruined, useless...broken...fucking fraud' during Lewis's moment of agony.

Ed Gentry.action: Ponders the situation with a 'kind of secret certainty' and tries to encourage the group by asserting they know where the threat will be.

Ed Gentry.action: Recovers control quickly after a moment of angry vehemence and calmly assesses the situation with Bobby.
Ed Gentry.assessment: This shows Ed's ability to regain composure under stress and think strategically, indicating a competent mindset.

Ed Gentry.action: Analyzes the tactical situation, recognizing that the enemy cannot come down but will wait above, and that their only escape is down the river.
Ed Gentry.assessment: This demonstrates Ed's situational awareness and logical reasoning, key indicators of competence.

Ed Gentry.action: Shouts at Lewis, blaming him and calling him a fraud, attempting to provoke a response.

Ed Gentry.action: Ponders the situation with a 'secret certainty' and confidently asserts that if the enemy knows their location, they will be positioned above.

Ed Gentry.action: Ed calmly analyzes the situation and tries to devise a plan to confront the threat, showing focus and determination.

Ed Gentry.action: Formulates a tactical plan to confront the enemy by predicting where he will position himself based on logical reasoning about the terrain and the enemy's behavior.

Ed Gentry.action: Maintains focus and concentration on the problem despite Bobby's doubts and fear.

Ed Gentry.action: Insists that either he or Bobby must take action to kill the enemy, pushing Bobby to confront his fear.

Ed Gentry.action: Does not directly answer Bobby's question about whether he can get up there in the dark, instead focusing on the plan.

Ed Gentry.action: Crouches down beside Lewis, who is in pain, and looks him in the face while responding honestly.

Ed Gentry.action: Observes the river quietly, mesmerized by its mystery before continuing his climb.

Ed Gentry.action: Prepares carefully with the bow and arrows, testing their condition before setting out.

Ed Gentry.action: Strings the bow, inspects arrows for straightness, and acknowledges he has only one good shot.

Ed Gentry.action: Crouches beside Lewis to assess his condition and listens to his intense instructions.

Ed Gentry.action: Admits to Lewis that he does not know exactly what he is doing and will make it up as he goes along.

Ed Gentry.action: Pauses to watch the river, mesmerized by its mystery before continuing to climb.

Ed Gentry.action: Pauses for a moment and smiles at a lone flower growing out of the rock while climbing the cliff.

Ed Gentry.action: Lies in the crevice stroking the curves of the bow and admiring the wild beauty of the river on fire with moonlight.

Ed Gentry.action: Mumbles profoundly 'What a view. What a view.' while lying in a precarious position.

Ed Gentry.action: Almost loses the bow but manages just barely to save it while climbing.

Ed Gentry.action: Lies trembling and sweating in the crevice, momentarily overwhelmed and sobbing.

Ed Gentry.action: Leans out to see the river better and almost falls, but manages to save his bow.

Ed Gentry.action: Sobs with relief after climbing out of the crevice and reaching the cliff top.

Ed Gentry.action: Carefully examines the cliff top and chooses a position for firing a rifle, noting the environment around him.

Ed Gentry.action: Carefully feels the crevice above his head and begins to climb out of it despite pain.
